014package org.microbean.construct.element;
015
016import java.util.Collection;
017import java.util.Iterator;
018import java.util.Map;
019import java.util.Map.Entry;
020import java.util.SequencedMap;
021
022import java.util.function.Predicate;
023
024import javax.lang.model.element.AnnotationMirror;
025import javax.lang.model.element.AnnotationValue;
026import javax.lang.model.element.ExecutableElement;
027import javax.lang.model.element.QualifiedNameable;
028
029import static java.util.Collections.unmodifiableSequencedMap;
030
031import static java.util.LinkedHashMap.newLinkedHashMap;
032
033import static javax.lang.model.util.ElementFilter.methodsIn;
034
035/**
036 * A utility class for working with annotations as represented by {@link AnnotationMirror}s, {@link ExecutableElement}s,
037 * and {@link AnnotationValue}s.
038 *
039 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson" target="_top">Laird Nelson</a>
040 */
041public final class AnnotationMirrors {
042
043  private static final SequencedMap<?, ?> EMPTY_MAP = unmodifiableSequencedMap(newLinkedHashMap(0));
044
045  private static final SameAnnotationValueVisitor sameAnnotationValueVisitor = new SameAnnotationValueVisitor();
046
047  private AnnotationMirrors() {
048    super();
049  }
050
051  /**
052   * For the supplied {@link AnnotationMirror}, returns an immutable, determinate {@link Map} of {@link AnnotationValue}
053   * instances indexed by its {@link ExecutableElement}s to which they apply.
054   *
055   * <p>Each {@link ExecutableElement} represents an <a
056   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se25/html/jls-9.html#jls-9.6.1">annotation element</a> and meets the
057   * requirements of such an element.</p>
058   *
059   * <p>Each {@link AnnotationValue} represents the value of an annotation element and meets the requirements for
060   * annotation values.</p>
061   *
062   * <p>This method is a more capable, better-typed replacement of the {@link
063   * javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getElementValuesWithDefaults(AnnotationMirror)} method, and should be preferred.</p>
064   *
065   * @param a an {@link AnnotationMirror}; may be {@code null} in which case an empty, immutable, determinate {@link
066   * Map} will be returned
067   *
068   * @return an immutable, determinate {@link Map} of {@link AnnotationValue} instances indexed by {@link
069   * ExecutableElement}s
070   *
071   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se25/html/jls-9.html#jls-9.6.1 Java Language Specification, section
072   * 9.6.1
073   *
074   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getElementValuesWithDefaults(AnnotationMirror)
075   */
076  public static final SequencedMap<ExecutableElement, AnnotationValue> allAnnotationValues(final AnnotationMirror a) {
077    if (a == null) {
078      return emptySequencedMap();
079    }
080    final Collection<? extends ExecutableElement> elements = methodsIn(a.getAnnotationType().asElement().getEnclosedElements());
081    if (elements.isEmpty()) {
082      return emptySequencedMap();
083    }
084    final SequencedMap<ExecutableElement, AnnotationValue> m = newLinkedHashMap(elements.size());
085    final Map<? extends ExecutableElement, ? extends AnnotationValue> explicitValues = a.getElementValues();
086    for (final ExecutableElement ee : elements) {
087      // You're going to want to use getOrDefault() here. Go ahead and try but you'll run into typing issues.
088      m.put(ee, explicitValues.containsKey(ee) ? explicitValues.get(ee) : ee.getDefaultValue());
089    }
090    return m.isEmpty() ? emptySequencedMap() : unmodifiableSequencedMap(m);
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Determines whether the two {@link AnnotationMirror}s represent the same (otherwise opaque) annotation.
095   *
096   * @param am0 an {@link AnnotationMirror}; may be {@code null}
097   *
098   * @param am1 an {@link AnnotationMirror}; may be {@code null}
099   *
100   * @return {@code true} if the supplied {@link AnnotationMirror}s represent the same (otherwise opaque) annotation;
101   * {@code false} otherwise
102   *
103   * @see #sameAnnotation(AnnotationMirror, AnnotationMirror)
104   */
105  public static final boolean sameAnnotation(final AnnotationMirror am0, final AnnotationMirror am1) {
106    return sameAnnotation(am0, am1, x -> true);
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Determines whether the two {@link AnnotationMirror}s represent the same (underlying, otherwise opaque) annotation.
111   *
112   * @param am0 an {@link AnnotationMirror}; may be {@code null}
113   *
114   * @param am1 an {@link AnnotationMirror}; may be {@code null}
115   *
116   * @param p a {@link Predicate} that returns {@code true} if a given {@link ExecutableElement}, representing an
117   * annotation element, is to be included in the computation; may be {@code null} in which case it is as if
118   * {@code ()-> true} were supplied instead
119   *
120   * @return {@code true} if the supplied {@link AnnotationMirror}s represent the same (underlying, otherwise opaque)
121   * annotation; {@code false} otherwise
122   *
123   * @see SameAnnotationValueVisitor
124   *
125   * @see #allAnnotationValues(AnnotationMirror)
126   */
127  public static final boolean sameAnnotation(final AnnotationMirror am0,
128                                             final AnnotationMirror am1,
129                                             Predicate<? super ExecutableElement> p) {
130    if (am0 == am1) {
131      return true;
132    } else if (am0 == null || am1 == null) {
133      return false;
134    }
135    if (p == null) {
136      p = x -> true;
137    }
138    final QualifiedNameable qn0 = (QualifiedNameable)am0.getAnnotationType().asElement();
139    final QualifiedNameable qn1 = (QualifiedNameable)am1.getAnnotationType().asElement();
140    if (qn0 != qn1 && !qn0.getQualifiedName().contentEquals(qn1.getQualifiedName())) {
141      return false;
142    }
143    final SequencedMap<ExecutableElement, AnnotationValue> m0 = allAnnotationValues(am0);
144    final SequencedMap<ExecutableElement, AnnotationValue> m1 = allAnnotationValues(am1);
145    if (m0.size() != m1.size()) {
146      return false;
147    }
148    final Iterator<Entry<ExecutableElement, AnnotationValue>> i0 = m0.entrySet().iterator();
149    final Iterator<Entry<ExecutableElement, AnnotationValue>> i1 = m1.entrySet().iterator();
150    while (i0.hasNext()) {
151      final Entry<ExecutableElement, AnnotationValue> e0 = i0.next();
152      final Entry<ExecutableElement, AnnotationValue> e1 = i1.next();
153      final ExecutableElement ee0 = e0.getKey();
154      if (p.test(ee0) &&
155          (!e0.getKey().getSimpleName().contentEquals(e1.getKey().getSimpleName()) ||
156           !sameAnnotationValueVisitor.visit(e0.getValue(), e1.getValue().getValue()))) {
157        return false;
158      }
159    }
160    return !i1.hasNext();
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * A convenience method that returns a value for an annotation element named by the supplied {@link CharSequence} and
165   * logically owned by the supplied {@link AnnotationMirror}, or {@code null} if no such value exists.
166   *
167   * @param am an {@link AnnotationMirror}; must not be {@code null}
168   *
169   * @param name a {@link CharSequence}; may be {@code null} in which case {@code null} will be returned
170   *
171   * @return the result of invoking {@link AnnotationValue#getValue() getValue()} on an {@link AnnotationValue}, or
172   * {@code null}
173   *
174   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code am} is {@code null}
175   *
176   * @see AnnotationValue
177   *
178   * @see #allAnnotationValues(AnnotationMirror)
179   */
180  public static final Object get(final AnnotationMirror am, final CharSequence name) {
181    if (name == null) {
182      return null;
183    }
184    for (final Entry<? extends ExecutableElement, ? extends AnnotationValue> e : allAnnotationValues(am).entrySet()) {
185      if (e.getKey().getSimpleName().contentEquals(name)) {
186        final AnnotationValue av = e.getValue();
187        return av == null ? null : av.getValue();
188      }
189    }
190    return null;
191  }
192
193  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
194  private static final <K, V> SequencedMap<K, V> emptySequencedMap() {
195    return (SequencedMap<K, V>)EMPTY_MAP;
196  }
197
198}
